thread.title_full: Odey Hedge Fund Said to Surge 9% Betting Against China - Bloomberg Business

author: Saijel Kishan
title: Odey Hedge Fund Said to Surge 9% Betting Against China
text:
Crispin Odey’s main hedge fund surged about 9 percent this month by betting against China after losing money on the wager earlier in the year, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
The gain by Odey European , a $3.2 billion strategy that bets on rises and falls in stocks, pared its estimated loss for the year to 5 percent as of Monday, the person said, asking not to be identified because the information is private.
Odey , whose firm manages $12.8 billion, told investors last month that a devaluation in China would mean deflation breaking out across the world. Global equities lost $2.7 trillion in value Monday on concern a market rout in the country, spurred by slowing exports and growth, will hurt the global economic outlook. China’s central bank cut interest rates and lowered the amount of cash banks must set aside.
The market rout has resulted in hedge funds nursing losses. The industry fell 2.3 percent this month through Aug. 21 and 1.1 percent this year, according to the HFRX Global Hedge Fund Index.
Odey European posted a record 19 percent loss in April, a month it described as “bloody.” The London-based firm told investors in a letter that it was “attacked on all sides” after betting that China’s economic troubles would cause a slowdown that could embroil the developed world.
Odey Asset Management was started in 1991.
